question: Given below are the atomic masses of the elements:
Li (7), Na (23), K (39), Ca (40), Cl (35.5), Br (80), Sr (88), I (127), Ba (137)
Which of the following doesn't form triad?
explanation: Dobereiner's triads consist of elements with similar chemical properties where the middle element's mass is the average of the others.
Li, Na, K is a triad.
Ca, Sr, Ba is a triad.
Cl, Br, I is a triad.
Cl (Non-metal), K (Metal), Ca (Metal) do not form a triad chemically.
